metadata.title: USN-6465-3 -- Linux kernel (GKE) vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Yu Hao and Weiteng Chen discovered that the Bluetooth HCI UART driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-31083)  Lin Ma discovered that the Netlink Transformation (XFRM) subsystem in the Linux kernel contained a null pointer dereference vulnerability in some situations. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-3772)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6465-3` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-headers-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-modules-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-tools-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-gke-tools-5.15.0-1046 - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-modules-iwlwifi-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-image-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-gke-headers-5.15.0-1046 - 5.15.0-1046.51 linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1046-gke - 5.15.0-1046.51 No subscription required  linux-image-gke - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-headers-gke - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-headers-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-tools-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-image-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-gke - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1046.45 linux-tools-gke - 5.15.0.1046.45 No subscription required
